column6: Liver, segment VII lesion; core biopsy:   Benign liver tissue with features of   steatohepatitis;    - portions of bile duct harmatoma (von Meyenburg   complex) present,    - no evidence of malignancy seen (see comment).   Comment: Given the technical difficulty in the   biopsy of this small lesion, the biopsy may not   representative. Clinico-radiological correlation   is recommended.CLINICAL HISTORY   Prev hx of breast ca. Segment VII lesion increasedin size.
column7: GROSS DESCRIPTION   The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data, and   designated "liver biopsy". It consists of 7 pieces of tissue measuring 0.4cm to   1.6cm in length.  (A1, A2; no reserve)
column8: MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION   Multiple step sections are examined. Multiple fragments of liver tissue show   benign hepatic parenchyma composed of lobules of one-to-two cell thick   trabeculae of steatohepatitic hepatocytes with interspersed portal tracts. The   hepatocytes show prominent macrovesicular steatosis (~ 40%), associated with   scattered foci of lobular inflammation (3 foci per 20x high power field).   Occasional ballooning degeneration is observed. The portal tracts show a mild   lymphocytic inflammation with well-visualised bile ducts. No significant bile   duct injury or periportal hepatitis is discerned.   There are two foci of dilated and mildly angulated bile ducts, morphologically   in keeping with portions of bile duct harmatoma (von Meyenburg complex). The   foci measure up to 1.5mm in maximum dimension. These bile ducts are GATA-3   negative, with only the surrounding lymphocytes showing nuclear positivity.   There is no morphological or immunohistochemical evidence of a metastatic breast   carcinoma present in this specimen. The slides from the previous mastectomy   (14:PB17539) and previous liver biopsy (15:PB80842) were reviewed.

column7:
GROSS DESCRIPTION
   The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data and
   designated "uterus, cervix, both fallopian tubes and ovaries". It consists of a
   total hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy specimen weighing 112g.
   The uterine corpus measures 5.7cm (supero-inferiorly) x 4.5cm (cornu to cornu) x
   4.5cm (antero-posteriorly), cervix with slit-like os measures 3.3cm in length x
   2.5cm in diameter. The right fallopian tube measures 6.5cm in length x 0.5cm in
   diameter, the right ovary measures 2.5 x 2 x 1.2cm, the left fallopian tube
   measures 6.5cm in length x.0.6cm in diameter and the left ovary measures 2.5 x
   1.5 x 1.2cm. The serosal surface is smooth. The endometrium measures 0.1cm in
   thickness. The anterior myometrium measures 1.8cm and the posterior myometrium
   measures 2.3cm in thickness.
   No gross lesion is seen in the uterine corpus and cervix. Both the fallopian
   tubes and ovaries are unremarkable.
   (A1-right fallopian tube and ovary, A2-left fallopian tube and ovary, A3-cervix,
   A4-endomyometrium)
column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
   The endometrium sampled is weakly proliferative, and includes occasional
   scattered cystically dilated glands, devoid of any cytologic atypia. Focal
   ciliated cell metaplasia is also seen. There is no evidence of hyperplasia or
   malignancy.
   The myometrium sampled shows no specific abnormalities. The cervix shows mild
   chronic inflammation. The ovaries and uterine tubes are within normal limits for
   age.

   All specimens are received, labelled with patient's data and designated as shown

   (A) "Left retroareolar tissue"
   Received fresh is a piece of tissue with orientation suture in-situ. The tissue

   (B) "Sentinel lymph node 1"
   Received fresh is a piece of tissue  measuring 1 x 1cm which is passed for
   frozen section evaluation. (B1FS; no reserve)
   (C) "Left nipple sparing mastectomy, stitch short-superior, long-lateral"
   Received in formalin is a nipple sparing mastectomy specimen measuring
   14cm(supero-inferiorly), 3cm(antero-posteriorly) and 14cm(medial-laterally).
   There is no skin ellipse or nipple present however the anterior surface shows a
   rounded depression measuring 3.5 x 2cm. A 1.5 x 0.6cm defect is seen anteriorly
   which leads to a cavity within the breast, more in the medial aspect and
   straddling the upper and lower quadrants.   This cavity measures
   2cm(supero-inferiorly), 0.8cm(antero-posteriorly) and 2cm(medial-laterally),
   6.5cm from the superior (closest radial) margin and 1.3cm from the posterior
   margin, and it is lined withfibrinous material.  No obvious tumour is seen
   grossly. The inner lining of the cavity is inked red and the posterior margin of
   the breast is inked green.
   (C1-shaved superior margin, C2-shaved posterior margin, C3-medial wall of the
   cavity, C4-superior wall of the cavity, C5-posterior wall of the cavity,
   C6-inferior wall of the cavity, C7-lateral wall of the cavity, C8-further
   section of cavity, C9-random outer lower quadrant, C10-random outer upper
   quadrant)
column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
   A.  The paraffin section of the frozen section tissue shows benign breast tissue
   with
         fibrocystic change and luminal microcalcifications.
   B.  The paraffin section of the frozen section tissue confirms a benign lymph
   node.
   C.  Left nipple sparing mastectomy:
   Sections show a cavity wall lined by granulation tissue with foreign body giant
   cells reaction, fat necrosis and haemorrhage.  The adjacent breast tissue shows
   fibrocystic change and luminal microcalcifications.  There is also usual ductal
   hyperplasia and sclerosing adenosis.  No residual in situ or invasive malignancy
   is seen.

column7:
GROSS DESCRIPTION
   The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data, and
   designated "Uterus, cervix, both fallopian tubes & right ovary".  The specimen
   weighs 487g and consists of a total hysterectomy specimen with both fallopian
   tubes and the right ovary. The specimen has been incised multiple times
   anteriorly prior to submission resulting in significant distortion to the
   endometrial cavity. The uterine corpus measures approximately 7cm (cornu to
   cornu) x 8cm (supero-inferiorly). The uterine cervix measures approximately 4cm
   (length) x 4cm (diameter). The right fallopian tube measures 8.5cm (length) x
   1cm (diameter). The left fallopian tube measures 5cm (length) x 1cm (diameter).
   The right ovary measures 4 x 3 x 1.5cm. The endometrium measures 0.4cm thick.
   The myometrium is 3cm thick posteriorly. Cut sections of the right ovary show a
   haemorrhagic corpus luteal cyst measuring 2cm in greatest dimension. There is a
   fibroid measuring 8 x 7 x 6cm in the fundus; cut sections show a white, whorled
   appearance with no necrosis.
   (A1-right fallopian tube, A2-right ovary with cyst, A3-left fallopian tube,
   A4-anterior lip of cervix, A5-posterior lip of cervix, A6&A7-endomyometrium,
   A8-endometrium, A9-rest of ovarian cyst, A10 to A12-representative sections of
   fibroid)
column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
   The cervix shows mild acute and chronic inflammatory infiltrate, negative for
   cervical intraepithelial neoplasia and adenocarcinoma in situ. The endometrium
   is secretory, negative for chronic endometritis and endometrial hyperplasia.
   Sections from the fibroid show intersecting fascicles of smooth muscle without
   tumor necrosis, nuclear atypia or increased mitotic activity. Both fallopian
   tubes and the right ovary are unremarkable, except for a haemorrhagic corpus
   luteal cyst in the right ovary. No malignancy is present.

column7:
GROSS DESCRIPTION
   All specimens are received, labelled with patient's data and designated as shown
   below.
   (A) "Left axillary sentinel lymph node"
   Received fresh is a piece of tissue measuring 1.9 x 0.9 x 0.4cm which is
   submitted for frozen section evaluation. (A1FS; no reserve)
   (B)  "Left breast wide excision, stitch short-superior, long-medial"
   Received in formalin is an irregularly shaped fat-covered lump with 2 sutures
   designated as "short - superior" and "long - medial". The specimen measures
   4cm(supero-inferiorly) x 2.8cm(medial-laterally) x 4.5cm(antero-posteriorly). A
   portion of a hook wire has been inserted at the anterior aspect. Sectioning
   reveals a spiculated cream, firm infiltrative mass measuring
   2.2cm(supero-inferiorly) x 2cm(medial-laterally) x 1cm(antero-posteriorly). The
   tumour abuts the superior and lateral margins, and is 1cm from the nearest
   inferior margin, 0.8cm from the medial margin, 0.3cm from the anterior margin
   and 1cm from the nearest posterior margin. The specimen is inked as follows:
   superior-yellow, medial-red, lateral-green, inferior-blue, anterior-orange and
   posterior-black.
   (B1 & B2-perpendicular anterior margin, inked orange, B3 & B4-perpendicular
   inferior margin, inked blue, B5 & B6-perpendicular medial margin, inked red, B7
   & B8-perpendicular posterior margin, inked black, B9 to B13-sequential sections
   of entire specimen from anterior to posterior; no reserve)
   (C) "Left breast new superior margin, stitch short-superior, long-lateral"
   Received in formalin is a piece of fibrofatty tissue with2 sutures designated
   as "short - superior" and "long - lateral". The specimen measures
   1cm(supero-inferiorly) x 4cm(medial-laterally) x 2.5cm(antero-posteriorly). The
   specimen is inked as follows: superior- yellow, lateral-red, inferior-black,
   posterior-blue, medial-orange and anterior-green.
   (C1-perpendicular medial margin, inked orange, C2 to C4-sequential sections from
   medial to lateral, C5-perpendicular lateral margin, inked red; no reserve)
   (D) "Left axillaryclearance"
   Received in formalin is a piece of fibrofatty tissue measuring 9 x 8 x 2.5cm.
   Few discrete lymph nodes are recovered measuring up to 1.5cm in widest
   dimension.
   (D1 to D3-discrete lymph nodes, D4 & D5-lymph nodes and fat; with reserve)
   (E) "Left axillary sentinel lymph node 2"
   Received in formalin is a tan rubbery lymph node measuring 1.3 x 0.8 x 0.5cm,
   partially covered with fat.
   (E1-bisected tissue; no reserve)
column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
   (A) "Left axillary sentinel lymph node":
   Paraffin sections confirm the frozen section diagnosis of one lymph node
   positive for metastatic carcinoma (1/1), measuring 5mm in maximum dimension on a
   single intact focus, without evidence of extracapsular tumour extension.
   (B)  "Left breast wide excision":
   Sections of the breast show an invasive carcinoma with mixed ductal and lobular
   features. The ductal component comprises cells with moderate-to-marked nuclear
   pleomorphism forming cohesive nests and infiltrative trabeculae. Focally, a
   morphologically distinct lobular component is seen, exhibiting relatively
   rounded cell contours and occasional intracytoplasmic lumina, arranged in linear
   files and vague targetoid configurations. E-cadherin immunohistochemical
   staining reveals strong membranous positivity within the ductal component, while
   the lobular component discloses diminished, incomplete, granular and punctate
  staining, corroborating the morphological impression. Minimal high-grade ductal
   carcinoma-in-situ (DCIS) is present. An isolated lobule suspicious for lobular
   carcinoma-in-situ (LCIS) is seen (B9); however, the lesional area is no longer
 present on a subsequent section obtained for E-cadherin immunohistochemical
   studies. Approximately 60% of the tumour bed is occupied by viable tumour, with
   the remaining area constituted by relatively hypocellular fibrocollagenous
   tissuecontaining a sparse infiltrate of chronic inflammatory cells.
   BREAST - INVASIVE CARCINOMA
    
   SIZE OF INVASIVE TUMOUR : 22mm in maximum dimension (macroscopic measurement)
   WHOLE SIZE OF TUMOUR (Invasive + DCIS) : 22mm in maximum dimension.
   EXTENT OF TUMOUR : Localised
   GRADE : 2 (Grading is performed on area showing highest grade features; however,
   prior neoadjuvant chemotherapy may affect representativeness of grading.)
   Tubule score: 3
   Nuclear pleomorphism: 3
   Mitotic score: 1 (2 mitoses per 10hpf, field diameter 0.55mm)
   HISTOLOGICAL TYPE : Mixed Ductal and Lobular
   VASCULAR INVASION : Not Seen
   ASSOCIATED DCIS   : Minimal (less than or equal to 25%)
   GRADE OF DCIS     : High
   SUBTYPE OF DCIS   : Solid
   ASSOCIATED LCIS   : See microscopic description above
   PAGET'S DISEASE   : Not assessable
   EXCISION MARGINS:
   Anterior: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 3mm away (macroscopic
   measurement).
   Posterior: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 10mm away (macroscopic
   measurement).
   Superior: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 2mm away.
   Inferior: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 10mm away (macroscopic
   measurement).
   Medial: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 8mm away (macroscopic
   measurement).
   Lateral: Uninvolved by DCIS/ Invasive tumour, located 9mm away.
   Closest excision margin is superior. Distance: 2mm.
   LYMPH NODES:
   Number of axillary nodes positive: 1
   Total number of axillary nodes    : 14 (Parts "A", "D" and "E").
   Sentinel node sampled: Yes  - Positive
   Internal mammary / Other nodes sampled: No
   Immunohistochemistry:
   The invasive carcinoma cells show the following staining characteristics:-
    
         Intensity   Percentage   Conclusion
         of staining   of cells
         (1+ to 3+)   stained
    
   ER      3+      90%      Positive
   PR      -      -      Negative
   c-erb-B2   1+      70%      Negative
    
   The specimen was fixed in formalin for 6-48 hours. A negative result for
   c-erb-B2 by immunohistochemical methods may not be valid if the specimen has
   been fixed for <6 hours or >48 hours. For ER and PR, negative results may not be
   valid if specimen fixation is <6 hours or >72 hours.
   Note : Paraffin sections of the formalin fixed tissue are stained for estrogen
   receptor using Neomarker RM9101-S, progesterone receptorusing Neomarker
   RM9102-S and c-erb-B2 using Neomarker RM9103-S. The detection system used is the
   Ventana multimer detection kit. For estrogen and progesterone receptor study, a
   result is considered positive if at least 1% of the lesional cells display any
   intensity of unequivocal nuclear staining. For c-erb-B2, a test is considered
   positive if at least 30% of the lesional cells exhibit 3+ cell membrane staining
   and a borderline/equivocal result is given when at least 10% of the lesional
   cells show 2+ cytoplasmic membrane staining.  Results which fail to fulfil the
   above criteria are considered negative.
   ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: The background breast parenchyma shows areas of adenosis,
   usual ductal hyperplasia, apocrine metaplasia and columnar cell change. Numerous
   intraductal microcalcifications are noted. An irregular area of fibrosis is
   seen, associated with haemosiderin-laden macrophages and foreign body-type giant
   cells, in keeping with changes expected at a previous biopsy site.
   (C) "Left breast new superior margin": The specimen has been submitted in its
   entirety for histological examination. A tiny focus of ductal carcinoma-in-situ
   (DCIS) measuring up to 1mm in largest lateral dimension, showing marked cautery
   artefact, is seen located 1mm from the nearest inked margin. No evidence of an
   invasive component is seen.
   (D) "Left axillary clearance": Sections show twelve benign reactive lymph nodes
   (0/12).
   (E) "Left axillary sentinel lymph node II": Sections show one benign reactive
   lymph node (0/1).
column9: Surgery (Left breast wide excision, Left axillary clearance)

   The specimen is inked as follows.

   Inferior-green
   Medial-blue
   Lateral-yellow
   Anterior-red
   Posterior-black

   No ulceration or other lesion is seen on the skin.
   The specimen is as follows.

   Inferior-green
   Medial-blue
   Lateral-yellow
   Anterior-red

   Cut sections show the following lesions:

   Lesion 3 - a tiny whitish firm area measuring 0.6 x 0.6 x 1cm, located 2.5cm

   It is located 1cm from posterior margin, 1.5cm from inferior margin, 4.5cm from

   (G1-perpendicular medial margin, G2-perpendicular lateral margin,
   Lesion 3:
   G3&G4-lesion 3 with closest posterior & inferior margin [entire lesion 3

   G6-perpendicular closest posterior margin of lesion 1, G7-lesion 1 with nipple

   lesion 2 submitted in G23, 16th slice of lesion 2 submitted in G24}; entire
   lesion 2 is extensively sampled)
   (H) Left inferior margin [stitch short superior long lateral]:
   Received in formalin is a piece offibrofatty tissue with 2 orientating sutures
   measuring 8.5cm (medio-laterally) x 5cm (antero-posteriorly) x 2cm
   (supero-inferiorly).
   The specimen is inked as follows.

   Inferior-green
   Medial-blue
   Lateral-yellow

   (H1&H2-perpendicular medial margin, H3 to H9-fatty area submit alternatively

   fibrotic areas submitted, [every 2 blocks is one slice], H20&H21-perpendicular

   (I) Left deep margin [stitch short superior long lateral];
   Received in formalin and consists of a piece of fibrofatty tissue with 2

   The specimen is inked as follows.

column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
   AFS.  Left sentinel lymph node 1:
   Paraffin sections of the frozen section specimen of lymph node confirm no
   evidence of malignancy.
   BFS. Left sentinel lymph node 2:
   Paraffin sections of the frozen section specimen of two lymph nodes confirm no
   evidence of malignancy.
   CFS. Left sentinel lymph node 3:
   Paraffin sections of the frozen section specimen of two lymph nodes confirm no
   evidence of malignancy.
   DFS. Left sentinel lymph node 4:
   Paraffin sections of the frozen section specimen confirm fatty tissue only; no
   lymph node is
   identified.
   E. Right breast ADH:
   DCIS
   SIZE: 2mm in maximum dimension
   NUMBER OF BLOCKS INVOLVED BY DCIS: 1
   EXTENT OF TUMOUR: Localised
   NUCLEAR GRADE:  Low
   SUBTYPE:  Solid
   NECROSIS: Absent
   CALCIFICATIONS: Absent
   EXCISION: Complete
   Closest radial margin:  Inferior
  Distance:  <1mm
   Additional margins:   Posterior, 29.5mm away
   PAGET'S DISEASE:   Not assessable
   MICROINVASION (less than or equal to 1mm): No
   LOBULAR NEOPLASIA (ALH/ LCIS) PRESENT:  No
   REGIONAL LYMPH NODES:
   SENTINELLYMPH NODE: Not sampled
   INTERNAL MAMMARY/ OTHER LYMPH NODES:  Not applicable
   Immunohistochemistry performed shows the following staining characteristics of
   the in-situ carcinoma cells:-
    
    
   ER: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+): 3+
   Percentage of cells stained: 90%
   Comment:
   PR: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+):  3+
   Percentage of cells stained: 90%
   Comment:
    
    
   (1) The specimen was fixed in formalin for 6-72 hours. A negative result for ER
   and PR by immunohistochemical methods may not be valid if specimen fixation is
   <6 hours or >72 hours.
   Note: Paraffin sections of the formalin fixed tissue are stained for estrogen
   receptor using Thermoscientific Estrogen Receptor SP1 (RM9101-S) and
   progesterone receptor using Ventana Progesterone Receptor 1E2. The detection
   system used is the Ventana multimer detection kit. For estrogen and progesterone
   receptor study, a result is considered positive if at least 1% of the tumour
   cells display any intensity of unequivocal nuclear staining. Tumours with 1-10%
   of ER expression are considered ER Low Positive. There are limited data on the
   overall benefit of endocrine therapy for patients with low level (1-10%) ER
   expression but they currently suggest possible benefit, so patients are
   considered eligible for endocrine treatment. Some data suggest that these
   tumours are heterogenous in both behaviour and biology, with gene expression
   profiles often similar to ER-negative cancers. Results which fail to fulfil the
   above criteria are considered negative.
   ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:
   Florid fibrocystic changes also present include sclerosing adenosis, intraduct
   papillomas, duct dilatation and cyst formation, columnar cell change, columnar
   cell hyperplasia, usual type epithelial hyperplasia, apocrine metaplasia, and
   apocrine cysts with papillary hyperplasia. Foci of atypical duct hyperplasia,
   atypical lobular hyperplasia and benign microcalcification are also seen.  An
   area of scarring represents the site of previous biopsy.
   F. Right medial margin:
   The entire specimen has been examined and consists predominantly of adipose
   tissue. Mild duct dilatation is also seen. No malignancy is identified.
   G. Left breast wide excision:
   Invasive breast tumour
   SIZE OF INVASIVE TUMOUR (Lesion 1) : 25mm in maximum dimension
   WHOLE SIZE OF TUMOUR (INVASIVE + DCIS): 25mm in maximum dimension
   EXTENT OF TUMOUR:  Multiple foci
   With reference to `Lesion 1', three small foci of in situ malignancy, up to
   2.5mm, are seen within 12mm of the posterior margin, and are situated up to 20mm
   away from the main tumour.
   With reference to `Lesion 2', the total area, measuring 90mm (medial-lateral)
   was divided into 15 slices, and incidental foci of malignancy were identified as
   follows, in the absence of any discrete mass;
   G11,  Medial part of the area, includes a focus of invasive and in situ
   malignancy, 6mm
             No included margins.
   G14  8th slice, includes scattered small foci of in situ malignancy extending up
   to 1mm from the superior margin
   G21 11th slice, includes a small focus of in situ malignancy, present 13mm from
   the posterior margin
   G22 12th slice includes a focus of in situ malignancy, 10mm. No included
   margins.
   The in situ component is partly represented by cancerisation and Pagetoid spread
   HISTOLOGICAL TUMOUR TYPE: Ductal NOS
   GRADE:  3  (Tubule score-3; nuclear pleomorphism-3; mitotic score-2)
       mitotic count: 8 per 10 high power fields; field diameter: 0.55mm
   ASSOCIATED DCIS: Minimal (less than or equal to 25%)
       Nuclear grade of DCIS: High
       Subtype of DCIS: Comedo/Solid
           NECROSIS:  Present
           CALCIFICATIONS:  Present
   ASSOCIATED LOBULAR NEOPLASIA : Absent (left breast)
   LYMPHOVASCULAR INVASION: Yes
   PAGET'S DISEASE: Absent
   Skeletal Muscle at the base:  Absent
   FOR WIDE EXCISION
   RESECTION MARGINS  (Main tumour, Lesion 1)
   Deep margin: 36/12mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma
   Superior margin:25mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma (gross)
   Inferior margin: 45mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma (gross)
   Lateral margin: 125mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma (gross)
   Medial margin: 35mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma (gross)
   Anterior margin: >8mm away from invasive/in situ carcinoma (gross)
   REGIONAL LYMPH NODES:
   SENTINEL LYMPH NODE: Sampled - metastatic tumour absent  (Refer A-CFS)
   INTERNAL MAMMARY/ OTHER LYMPH NODES:  Not applicable
   TREATMENT EFFECT/ RESPONSE TO PRESURGICAL (NEOADJUVANT) THERAPY:
   No known presurgical therapy
   ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:
   Additional findings in the area described as `Lesion 2' are the following florid
   fibrocystic features; duct dilatation and cyst formation, intraductal and
   sclerosing papillomas, usual type epithelial hyperplasia, columnar cell change
   and hyperplasia, apocrine cyst formation with papillary hyperplasia and atypical
   duct hyperplasia. Benign calcification, pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia
   and scarring related to previous biopsy are also noted.
   The area described as `Lesion 3' comprises fibrocystic changes, including a
   fibroadenomatoid area.
   H. Left inferior margin:
   Fibrocystic changes seen are similar to those described previously, including
   benign calcification.
   I. Left deep margin:
   The entire specimen has been examined, and predominantly consists of adipose
   tissue, with scant ducts identified.  A small amount of skeletal muscle is
   included.

column6:
(A) Right breast, UIQ mass, biopsy
   -Invasive carcinoma with ductal features
   (B) Left breast, 10:00-12:00, biopsy
   -Intermediate grade ductal carcinoma-in-situ with focus suspicious for invasive
   carcinoma
   (C)Left breast, retroareolar mass, biopsy
   -Invasive carcinoma with ductal features
column7:
GROSS DESCRIPTION
   (A) The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data and
   designated "right breast UIQ mass". It consists of 4 cores ofwhitish fibrofatty
   tissue measuring from 0.7cm to 1.6cm in length. (A1; no reserve)
   (B) The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data and
   designated "left breast 10:00-12:00". It consists of 5 cores of whitish
 fibrofatty tissue measuring from 0.2cm to 1.2cm in length. (B1; no reserve)
   (C) The specimen is received in formalin, labelled with patient's data and
   designated "left breast retroareolar". It consists of 4 cores of whitish
   fibrofatty tissue measuring from 0.8cm to 1.7cm in length. (C1; no reserve)
   - The specimens were fixed in formalin for 6-72 hours.
column8:
MICROSCOPIC DESCRIPTION
     A) Section shows multiple breast tissue cores with malignant cell nests
   forming confluent
   trabeculae and small nests. Tumor cells show moderate to marked nuclear atypia,
   tubular differentiation and increased mitotic activity (15-20/10 high power
   fields). Largest focus of invasive tumor measures ~10mm lacking any
   myoepithelial cell decoration on immunostains (CK5/6, CK14 and p63).
   Lymphovascular invasion cannot be excluded. No lobular neoplasia is noted
   supported by strong membrane E-cadherin staining.
   Provisional grade 2-3
   IMMUNOHISTOCHEMISTRY
   For estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR) and cerb-B2 receptor
   following
   staining pattern is seen in the  invasive carcinoma cells
    
   ER: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+):  3+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity:  ~90%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   PR: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+): 2+ to 3+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity:  5-10%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   c-erb-B2: Negative
   Negative (1+): Faint/ barely perceptible, incomplete membrane staining in more
   than 10% of tumour cells.
   See comment:
     B) Section shows multiple breast cores with atypical epithelial proliferation
   with solid and
   papillary architecture with superimposed ductal hyperplasia and columnar cell
   changes in the background of stromal fibrosis. Features are consistent with
ductal carcinoma-in-situ, measuring 6mm in largest dimension in a single core. A
   small focus of infiltrating tumor with irregular edges lack any myoepithelial
   cell decoration on immunostains (CK5/6, CK14, SMMS and p63).This focus is
   suspicious for invasive tumor (~1mm). Positive and/or negative controls are
   acceptable.
   IMMUNOHISTOCHEMISTRY
   For estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR) and cerb-B2 receptor
   following
   staining pattern is seen in the  invasive carcinoma cells
    
   ER:   Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+):  3+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity:  95%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   PR: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+): 2+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity: 10%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   c-erb-B2: Negative
   Negative (1+): Faint/ barely perceptible, incomplete membrane staining in more
   than 10% of tumour cells.
   See comment:
   C) Section shows multiple breast tissue cores with malignant cell nests forming
   confluent trabeculae and small nests. Tumor cells show moderate to marked
  nuclear atypia, focal tubular differentiation and increased mitotic activity
   (>20/10 high power fields). Largest focus of invasive tumor measures ~8mm
   lacking any myoepithelial cell decoration on immunostains (CK5/6, CK14 and p63).
   Small foci of ductal carcinoma-in-situ with solid and cribriform architecture
   are noted. Lymphovascular invasion cannot be excluded. No lobular neoplasia is
   noted supported by strong membrane E-cadherin staining.
   Provisional grade: 2-3.
  IMMUNOHISTOCHEMISTRY
   For estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR) and cerb-B2 receptor
   following
   staining pattern is seen in the  invasive carcinoma cells
    
   ER: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+): 3+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity: 95%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   PR: Positive
   Staining intensity (1+ to 3+): 3+
   Percentage of cells with nuclear positivity: ~5%
   Comment: Positive internal control is present
   c-erb-B2: Equivocal
   Equivocal (2+): Weak-to-moderate, complete membrane staining in 10-20% of tumour
   cells
   Comment:
   +The following criteria apply for evaluation of c-erb-B2 staining:
   - Negative (0): No staining; or faint/ barely perceptible, incomplete membrane
   staining in less than or equal to 10% of tumour cells
   - Negative (1+): Faint/ barely perceptible, incomplete membrane staining in more
   than 10% of tumour cells
   - Equivocal (2+): Weak-to-moderate, complete membrane staining in more than 10%
   of tumour cells; or intense, complete membrane staining in less than or equal to
   10% of tumour cells
   - Positive (3+): Intense, complete membrane staining in more than 10% of tumour
   cells
    
    
   The specimen was fixed in formalin for 6-72 hours. A negative result for
   c-erb-B2, ER and PR by immunohistochemical methods may not be valid if specimen
   fixation is <6 hours or >72 hours.
   Note: Paraffin sections of the formalin fixed tissue are stained for estrogen
   receptor using Thermoscientific Estrogen Receptor SP1 (RM9101-S), progesterone
   receptor using Ventana Progesterone Receptor 1E2 and c-erb-B2 using
   Thermoscientific c-erb-B2 SP3 (RM9103-S). The detection system used is the
   Ventana multimer detection kit. For estrogen and progesterone receptor study, a
   result is considered positive if at least 1% of the tumour cells display any
   intensity of unequivocal nuclear staining. Tumours with 1-10% of ER expression
   are considered ER Low Positive. There are limited data on the overall benefit of
   endocrine therapy for patients with low level (1-10%) ER expression but they
   currently suggest possible benefit, so patients are considered eligible for
   endocrine treatment. Some data suggestthat these tumours are heterogenous in
   both behaviour and biology, with gene expression profiles often similar to
   ER-negative cancers. For c-erb-B2, a test is considered positive if more than
   10% of the tumour cells exhibit 3+ (complete, intense) membrane staining and an
   equivocal result (synonymous with the "borderline" terminology present in some
   previous reports) is given when more than 10% of the tumour cells show 2+
   (complete, weak-to-moderate) membrane staining. Incomplete, faint/barely
   perceptible membrane staining regardless of the percentage of lesional cells
   involved are considered negative, along with the cases that show no staining at
   all. Unusual staining patterns that are not covered by these definitions should
   also be considered equivocal (2+) and followed by FISH testing. Results which
   fail to fulfil the above criteria are considered negative.
